content: up the other side of the heel and knit the next 38 sts knit the 40 instep stitches once more at this point make sure that however many needles you are using the 40 instep stitches and the 50 foot stitches are on separate needles in my case this meant 40 instep sts on one needle and 50 sts on the other but you could divide each of these two sets of stitches in half again across four double pointed needles shaping the instep round 1 k1 ssk knit to the last 3 of the foot sts k2tog k1 knit the 40 instep sts round 2 knit repeat these two rounds until you are back to a total of 80 sts the foot knit 30 rounds or until the foot measures 23 cm / 9 from the back of the heel the toes round 1 k1 ssk k to the last 3 sts of the foot sts k2tog k1 k1 ssk k to the last 3 sts of the instep sts k2tog k1 round 2 knit repeat these two rounds until you have a total of 32 sts on your needles re-arrange the sts on 2 needles and graft the toe together hold the two needles together with the wool coming from the needle at the back needle b the needle in the front is needle a cut the wool leaving a long end thread a blunt needle with it and start grafting thread through the first st on a pwise and the first st on b kwise leave both sts on their needles *thread through the first st on a kwise and pull it off the needle thread through the next st on a pwise and leave it on thread through the first st on b pwise and pull it off the needle thread through the next st on b kwise and leave it on repeat from * until all the sts are grafted together the hanging tab using 4mm needles cast on 4 sts work 40 row in single moss stitch row 1 k1 p1 twice row 2 p1 k1 twice cast off fold and sew to the top of the stocking you can vary this basic pattern by using different colours and stitch patterns or any combination of the above your choice of stitch pattern may alter the gauge but if so just choose a needle size to give you 10 sts in 5 cm and then work the number of row needed for the measurements given the tweed stocking i knitted this version in rowan pure wool dk 125m / 50g using 30g each of red 036 and cream 043 and 60g of green 022 the slip_stitch tweed pattern i used looks intricate but you are only working two rounds of each colour the slipped stitches make all the difference i have written out the 12 row repeating pattern below but you will find that you soon learn it
